BETOPff 3 $ILL;,Memorandum by the Minister of^Agriculture,and.Fisheries.I desire to introduce the Agricultural Returns Bill, copies of which are circulated herewith.The Bill reproduces .in effect the provisions of section fifteen of the' Corn Production Act, 1917, which wa3 repealed with the rest of that Act as the.powers were expressly stated to be given "in order to obtain such information as is necessary for the purpose of the proper exercise by the Board of their powers under this Act".The desired returns have for many years been obtained without compulsion, but there are in each year a few persons who decline to make returns. To secure complete statistics a power to deal with such persons is desired and this proposal is approved by the principal -bodies representing agricultural opinion. Following the precedent of the Corn Production Act the Bill provides for the form of return being settled by regulations laid before Parliament.Unless the Committee considers that adherence to this precedent is desirable I should prefer to omit sub-section (7) dealing with this point.It is proposed to introduce the Bill in the Houseof Lords.R.A.S.Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries. 19th March, 1923.
